segments.text: I see the serene garden outside the window, and it feels like a different world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight pours through the panes, casting a comforting glow in the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, my gaze drifts to the woman, blissfully unaware of the chaos unfolding behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water cascades over the sink, and I can't help but feel a pang of anxiety watching it spill.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how easily a seemingly normal day can turn into a disaster in seconds.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is on that rickety stool, stretching dangerously far for cookies, and I feel a knot tighten in my stomach.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Every movement of his sends a jolt of worry through me, but he looks so thrilled.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the girl, standing there with her hand out, looks so innocent and eager.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can something so playful also feel so perilous?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope the woman notices before something serious happens.
segments.speaker: PAR
